anns.prefix: Bioinformatic identification and characterization of the mpa cluster of P. roqueforti Bioinformatic identification and characterization of the mpa cluster of P. roqueforti Bioinformatic identification and characterization of the mpa cluster of P. roqueforti The highly conserved MpaF protein, encoded by the
anns.postfix: gene from P. brevicompactum, was used to scan the whole draft genome of P. roqueforti [18] by tBlastN. Two contigs (GenBank accessions CBMR010000200 and CBMR010000309) containing ORFs encoding proteins with significant similarity to MpaF were identified and downloaded.

anns.postfix: gene from P. brevicompactum, was used to scan the whole draft genome of P. roqueforti [18] by tBlastN. Two contigs (GenBank accessions CBMR010000200 and CBMR010000309) containing ORFs encoding proteins with significant similarity to MpaF were identified and downloaded.

anns.prefix: Taking into account the conserved genetic organization of the
anns.postfix: cluster and the high identity between the coding regions of the mpa genes, few differences in the MPA production levels between P. roqueforti and P. brevicompactum would be expected.

anns.prefix: Thus, we tested if the co
anns.postfix: rison of non-coding regions between the mpa clusters could shed lights over these differences.

anns.prefix: Our results indicated that the similarity between the intergenic regions is extremely low (S5 Fig), suggesting that the differences in MPA production between both fungi could be due to differences in the promoter sequences, which in turn would produce putative differences in the expression patterns of their
anns.postfix: genes.

anns.prefix: In the future, this hypothesis should be tested by the co
anns.postfix: rative analysis of the expression of the mpa genes in both fungi.

anns.prefix: The filamentous fungus
anns.postfix: is widely known as the ripening agent of blue-veined cheeses.

anns.prefix: Cheeses ripened with
anns.postfix: are usually contaminated with MPA.

anns.prefix: However, to date the molecular basis of the production of MPA by
anns.postfix: is still unknown.

Interestingly, the mpaF gene, originally described in
anns.postfix: as a MPA self-resistance gene, also exerts the same function in P. roqueforti, suggesting that this gene has a dual function in MPA metabolism.

anns.prefix: The knowledge of the biosynthetic pathway of MPA in
